required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Performance of Pulse Oximeter Sensors in Neonates
clinical_study.official_title: Validate Pulse Oximeter Sensors in Neonates by Comparing Sensor Readings to Blood Samples During Cardiac Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Taiwan Aulisa Medical Devices Technologies, Inc.

clinical_study.source: Taiwan Aulisa Medical Devices Technologies, Inc.

brief_summary.textblock: Validate pulse oximeter sensors in neonates by comparing sensor readings to blood samples during cardiac surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: Researchers at the University of California, San Francisco have developed methods that permit them to test multiple pulse oximeter sensors on neonates simultaneously during cardiac surgery. During this type of surgery, the arterial oxygen saturation changes over a wide range, providing an ideal arena for the assessment of neonatal pulse oximeter sensors at many levels of oxygen saturation. Several arterial blood gas samples are typically obtained during these procedures. Saturation of each arterial blood sample is determined by direct oximetry in a hemoximeter and this measurement is compared to the reading displayed on the pulse oximeter.

primary_outcome.measure: Performance of Pulse Oximeter Sensor in Neonates
primary_outcome.time_frame: Data are collected anywhere from the beginning of surgery until the completion of the procedure
primary_outcome.description: Pulse Oximeters - Premarket Notifications Submissions [510(k)s] Guidance For Industry and Food and Drug Administration Staff (issued: March 4, 2013)

arm_group.description: neonatal patients undergoing complex cardiac surgical procedures

intervention.description: Aulisa's non-invasive pulse oximeter sensor is applied to a foot of the neonate; an adhesive patch secures the sensor to the neonate.

study_pop.textblock: Neonatal patients undergoing complex cardiac surgical procedures.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Neonates scheduled to undergo cardiac surgery where routine blood draws would be taken
- Consent signed by at least one legal guardian
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of any skin irritation or breakdown on the foot
- Foot impediments which would preclude proper placement of the sensor
- Clinical condition precluding the use of adhesive materials

overall_official.affiliation: UCSF Medical Center at Mission Bay

facility.name: UCSF Medical Center at Mission Bay
